body: LGTM~
Yep agreed. We can remove the instanceof check and just log it.
@Jaskey I'll merge this PR soon. Please close this issue.

@lizhanhui 

> Can we maintain semantics of the original config and name this specific config something like flowControlThresholdByTopic?

This already done in my current pr.


What I suggest is one of the following:

1. Separate two config in two config field , pullThresholdForQueue  and pullThresholdForTopic, they both take effect. 

2.Separate two config in a boolean config, by default , it is control on queue level.

Any one of this is OK to me.


However, introducing one more boolean config and a topic level config is not clean enough , which we have to maintain three config to do this.

And user must understand the inner logic so that they can config well. Besides, we will find it hard to not easy to make them understood.


@zhouxinyu @shroman @vongosling 
What do you think?
Thank you @vongosling @lizhanhui @zhouxinyu
@lizhanhui @Jaskey we'd better close after merge :-)

Do you guys really consider that is good enough? @vongosling @lollipopjin 

IMO, the origin design is OK, since the AuthenticationException is thrown from the hook.

The devs should have log their own Authentication fail log already (may be print periodically or somehow ), but rocketmq remoting should only care about the real error.

If we remove it, all authentication fail will have one log, and this could be possibly  very often and fill up with the remoting log, which I do not think it is good enough.  Just imagine an unauthorized client to continue to do continually some periodical job like  heart beat/persist offset and continually  produce the AuthenticationException .

User should care about their custom authentication log, and remoting component should care about real error thrown from the processor.

If we remove it, all authentication fail will have one log, and this could be possibly very often and fill up with the remoting log, which I do not think it is good enough.

We can just keep it as the previous. We will introduce a new remoting module in the 4.1 with serious consideration about exception mechanism~

@vongosling OK, look forward to that! 

So when will this pr be merged?
Could you remove the code snippet “ (!(e instanceof AuthenticationException)) {” and class AuthenticationException

If no special consideration for authentication errors is needed (which was obviously the intention in the original code), +1 for just removing the hard-coded snippet. No `AuthenticationException` is needed then.
I see no problem logging on every `Throwable`.
Merged

What I intend to deliver is that it's always good to have simple API, but it would be miserably unexpected to change semantics of a configuration quietly. Further, it's best not to introduce overhead for the features application developers may not need. This is why I suggest to introduce a boolean switch to short circuit it on default at the very beginning.
This is quick fix of typo and we have collected three +1s. Now it's merged.
@vesense Please close this issue at your convenient time.
+1, Thanks @vesense
Thanks & Closed.
+1 from me
Merged to `develop` branch. Thanks @vesense. Please close this PR.
Thanks & Closed.
@shroman @zhouxinyu any idea on this PR?

The logic here shares much similar logic with ClientLogger class, can we extract the common part into a reusable method?
@shroman @vongosling  Any idea on this PR?

>  So do you agree this is indeed an issue that needed to be solved? If yes, I will try doing that.

Changing specific dependency to a neutral logging framework is good to have as application developer may integrate tool module to their operation management system.

 > But actually it is a little different from the clientLogger since clientlogger will use the resources file in the classpath by default while tools admin does not have config file in the classpath.

I know this, but it does not look like a blocking issue.

Hi @Ah39 ,

I am not sure is this PR a real demand, since we have `mqadmin` tool.

On the other hand, do we have any method to intercept or approve the requests from telnet client, like a hook?

Maybe  the QA and other rd may need the telnet tool. They can not use the mqadmin tool.
They may need know the topic infomation and connection , so telnet is most useful tool
@Ah39 Maybe console is a better tool for QA, and your concern makes sense indeed, let's wait for other committers' thoughts.

@lizhanhui @zhouxinyu @shroman 
Any more advice on this pr? and when can this be merged?

Repeated messages is a big problem for a message queue, and this is a known issue. When can this pr be reviewed and merged?
@lizhanhui @zhouxinyu @vongosling
